channel.title: Changing NPC speech?
channel.description:
Hi,
I'm using a source and i'm a total noob at all this coding stuff. I can't actually code, i just change text and numbers and compile.
Anyway, as I mentioned I am using a source, and my problem is that the NPCs keep announcing 'Welcome to blahblahblahscape!'. That isn't what I want. I want them to stop saying blahblahblahscape and start saying wafflewafflewafflescape.
Yes, I did just replace the real names with blahblahblah and wafflewafflewaffle.
Anyway, all I need someone to do is tell me which files to edit. I edited NPChandler.java to what I wanted, saved and then compiled but now NPChandler.java has reverted to what it was before I edited it, and the compilation has not worked although it says it was successful.
Sorry if there were any or many spelling mistakes in that, Retard Monkey

item.title: Changing NPC speech?

@i_pk_pjers_i wrote:

[quote=“Retard Monkey, post:3, topic:228167”]Oh my god why didn’t I try that in the first place?
Cause i’m a plonka!
Thanks, I’d rep if i could.[/quote]No, because you’re a retarded monkey that can’t even leech properly.

Read full topic

item.title: Changing NPC speech?
item.dc:creator: @Retard_Monkey Retard Monkey
item.description:
@Retard_Monkey wrote:

Hi,

I’m using a source and i’m a total noob at all this coding stuff. I can’t actually code, i just change text and numbers and compile.

Anyway, as I mentioned I am using a source, and my problem is that the NPCs keep announcing ‘Welcome to blahblahblahscape!’. That isn’t what I want. I want them to stop saying blahblahblahscape and start saying wafflewafflewafflescape.

Yes, I did just replace the real names with blahblahblah and wafflewafflewaffle.

Anyway, all I need someone to do is tell me which files to edit. I edited NPChandler.java to what I wanted, saved and then compiled but now NPChandler.java has reverted to what it was before I edited it, and the compilation has not worked although it says it was successful.

Sorry if there were any or many spelling mistakes in that,
Retard Monkey
